references.paper_title: Ubnormal: New benchmark for supervised open-set video anomaly detection
references.reason: This paper introduces the UBnormal dataset, which the current paper uses and on which it achieves state-of-the-art results.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the CLIP model, which is used as a key component for key frame selection in the AnyAnomaly model.

references.paper_title: Chat-univi: Unified visual representation empowers large language models with image and video understanding
references.reason: This paper presents Chat-UniVi, a large vision language model that AnyAnomaly adapts and builds upon for its C-VAD implementation.

references.paper_title: Abnormal event detection at 150 fps in matlab
references.reason: This paper introduces the CUHK Avenue dataset, which is one of the benchmark VAD datasets used for evaluation in the AnyAnomaly paper.

references.paper_title: Future frame prediction for anomaly detection-a new baseline
references.reason: This paper is a seminal work in video anomaly detection, using future frame prediction, and is thus a key reference for background and motivation.
